details.description: What you need to do about driving if you're had any type of angioplasty, including coronary or balloon angioplasty in your leg
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA if you’ve had angioplasty.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA that you’ve had any type of angioplasty.

However, you should stop driving for at least 1 week after this procedure and only start driving again when your doctor says that you are safe to do so. Read ‘Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions’ for more information about heart conditions and driving.

Download ‘CLE1066 - Car or motorcycle drivers with heart conditions’ (PDF, 129KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA if you’ve had any type of angioplasty.

Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘VOCH1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 340KB)
